node.title: 'Saved by coal': Why India refuses to give up an ecosystem that gives life to millions
node.alt: An Indian couple push a bicycle loaded with heavy white bags through a town street at night
node.description: India fought for a watered-down final deal at COP26 because coal remains itsÂ biggest source of fuel for electric power, tied to millions of jobs and livelihoods, with no viable alternative in sight.
node.content:
["Every night, Raju straps half a dozen sacks of coal pilfered from mines \u2014 weighing up to 200 kilograms\u00a0\u2014 to the reinforced metal frame of his bike, and cycles 16 kilometres to traders who pay him $US2 ($2.70).", "Thousands of others do the same.", "This has been Raju's life since he arrived in Dhanbad, an eastern Indian city in Jharkhand state, in 2016.\u00a0", "Annual floods in his home region have destroyed most\u00a0traditional farm jobs, so\u00a0coal is all he has.", "This is what\u00a0climate change conferences like the COP26 are up against.", "After pressure from India and China, the wording of the COP26's\u00a0final deal was diluted\u00a0to a pledge to \"phase down\" rather than \"phase out\" coal.", "The last-minute alteration left COP26 president Alok Sharma\u00a0on the brink of tears, bringing a strong\u00a0rebuke from the US and other nations.", "", "
A coal-powered steel plant at Hehal village near Ranchi, in the eastern Indian state of Jharkhand.(AP: Altaf Qadri)
", "The Earth desperately needs people to stop burning coal, the biggest single source of greenhouse gases, to avoid the most catastrophic impacts of climate change \u2014 including the intense flooding that has cost agricultural jobs in India.", "
'Many Indians have been saved by coal'
", "Coal remains the world's biggest source of fuel for electric power. So many, desperate like Raju, depend on it for their very lives.", "The developing world argues it\u00a0should be allowed the \"carbon space\" to grow as developed nations have, by burning cheap fuels like coal, which is used in industrial processes such as steelmaking along with electric power generation.", "On average, the typical American uses 12 times more electricity than the typical Indian. And there are over 27 million people in India who don't have electricity at all.", "", "
Around 300,000 Indians are employed at government-owned coal mines, including this woman in Dhanbad,\u00a0Jharkhand state.(AP: Altaf Qadri)
", "Power demand in India is expected to grow faster than anywhere in the world over the next two decades.", "And as its economy grows and ever more extreme heat increases, India's need for air conditioning that so much the rest of the world takes for granted is also certain to increase.", "
Coal India aims for 1 billion tonnes by 2024
", "Meeting that demand will not fall to people like Raju, but to Coal India.", "It is\u00a0already the world's largest miner, which aims to increase production to 1 billion tonnes a year by 2024.", "D.D. Ramanandan, the secretary at the Centre of Indian Trade Unions in Ranchi, said that conversations of moving beyond coal were only taking place in Paris, Glasgow or New Delhi.", "They had hardly begun in India's coal belt.", "", "
Workers typically earn less than $5 a day from the sacks of coal they deliver to Indian traders.\n\n\u00a0\u00a0(AP: Altaf Qadri)
", "A 2021 Indian government study found that Jharkhand state -- among the poorest in India and the state with the nation's largest coal reserves -- is also the most vulnerable Indian state to climate change.", "But there are roughly 300,000 people working directly with government-owned coal mines, earning fixed salaries and benefits.", "
'Coal is an ecosystem' in India
", "And there are nearly 4 million people in India whose livelihoods are directly or indirectly linked to coal, said Sandeep Pai, who studies energy security and climate change at the Center for Strategic and International Studies in Washington.", "India's coal belt is dotted by industries that need the fuel, like steel and brick making. The Indian railways, the country's largest employers, earns half its revenue by transporting coal, allowing it to subsidise passenger travel.", "\"Coal is an ecosystem,\" Mr Pai said.", "", "
India's\u00a0coal-dependent regions have to diversify their economies and retrain workers, experts say.(AP: Altaf Qadri)
", "For people like Naresh Chauhan, 50, and his wife Rina Devi, 45, India's economic slowdown resulting from the pandemic has intensified their dependence on coal.", "The two have lived in a village at the edge of the Jharia coalfield in Dhanbad all their lives.", "Accidental fires, some of which have been blazing for decades, have charred the ground and left it spongy.", "Smoke hisses from cracks in the surface near their hut. Fatal sinkholes are common.", "The couple earn $US3 ($4.10) a day selling four baskets of scavenged coal to traders.", "", "
Coal mines remain crucial for India which is predicted to see energy needs grow faster than any other nation.(AP: Altaf Qadri)
", "Families who have lived amid coal mines for generations rarely own any land they can farm and have nowhere else to go.", "Naresh hopes that his son would learn to drive so that he, at least, could get away. But even that may not be enough.", "
Coal thrives as other businesses suffer
", "There's less work for the city's existing taxi drivers.", "Wedding parties, who in the past reserved cars to ferry guests, have shrunk. Fewer travellers come to the city than before.", "That could mean even harder times for the people in Dhanbad as the world eventually does turn away from coal.", "Mr Pai says this is already happening as renewable energy gets cheaper and coal becomes less and less profitable.", "India and other countries with coal-dependent regions have to diversify their economies and retrain workers, he said.", "This is both to protect the livelihoods of workers and to help speed the transition away from coal by offering new opportunities.", "Otherwise, more will end up like Murti Devi. The 32-year-old single mother of four lost the job she had all her life when the mine she worked for closed four years ago.", "Nothing came of the resettlement plans promised by the coal company so she, like so many others, turned to scavenging coal.", "On good days, she'll make a dollar. On other days, she relies on neighbours for help.", "AP/ABC"]
